citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
The facility representative indicated they did not have access to records that they believed were locked in a safe and that
the individual with access was not available during the inspection. Inability to access required records at registered site
impedes APHIS officials' ability carry out official duties. Each exhibitor shall during business hours, allow APHIS officials
to examine records required to be kept by the Act and the regulations.
Correct from this date forward of 29 November 2023.

The water receptacle in the primary enclosure for 3 adult and 2 juvenile domestic pigs contains mostly ice that is adhered
to the walls and has approximately 1/2 cup of liquid water at the bottom. One adult pig was observed drinking from the
water at the bottom of the receptacle. The inspector asked for water to be added to the receptacle. Immediately after the
facility representative added water, 2 pigs were seen drinking intermittently from the water receptacle for approximately 30
seconds. The small amount of available drinking water for 5 pigs at time of inspection may lead to their discomfort. If
potable water is not accessible to the animals at all times, it must be provided as often as necessary for the health and
comfort of the animal. Corrected at time of inspection.
Correct from this date forward of 29 November 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.126(a)(2) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
The facility representative indicated they did not have access to records that they believed were locked in a safe and that 
the individual with access was not available during the inspection. Inability to access required records at registered site 
impedes APHIS officials' ability carry out official duties. Each exhibitor shall during business hours, allow APHIS officials 
to examine records required to be kept by the Act and the regulations. 
 
Correct from this date forward of 29 November 2023. 
3.130 
   
Watering. 
The water receptacle in the primary enclosure for 3 adult and 2 juvenile domestic pigs contains mostly ice that is adhered 
to the walls and has approximately 1/2 cup of liquid water at the bottom. One adult pig was observed drinking from the 
water at the bottom of the receptacle. The inspector asked for water to be added to the receptacle. Immediately after the 
facility representative added water, 2 pigs were seen drinking intermittently from the water receptacle for approximately 30 
seconds. The small amount of available drinking water for 5 pigs at time of inspection may lead to their discomfort. If 
potable water is not accessible to the animals at all times, it must be provided as often as necessary for the health and 
comfort of the animal. Corrected at time of inspection. 
 
Correct from this date forward of 29 November 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative. 
 
 n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
